prompts.prompt: Can you check if my JavaScript closures page is optimized for search engines? I want to make sure it will rank well when developers search for closure tutorials.
I wrote a title for my async/await article: 'Understanding Asynchronous JavaScript'. Is this good for SEO or should I change it?
My event loop concept page has 800 words but isn't showing up in Google searches. Can you audit the whole thing and tell me what's wrong?
I need help writing a meta description for my JavaScript Promises guide that will get clicks from search results.
How should I structure my DOM manipulation tutorial so it can win featured snippets on Google?
I have a JavaScript concepts site and my 'this keyword' page seems isolated - no other pages link to it. Can you help me fix the internal linking strategy?
My prototype inheritance article keeps getting outranked by other sites. Can you do a full competitive SEO analysis and give me an action plan to improve rankings?
Where should I put the keyword 'JavaScript type coercion' in my article to maximize SEO without making it sound robotic?
I'm launching 15 JavaScript concept pages next month. Can you create an SEO checklist I can use to audit each one before publishing?
My higher-order functions page has multiple H1 tags, a 45-character title, and 12 outbound links but no internal ones. Can you prioritize what I should fix first for the biggest SEO impact?
